xtrememp.visualization

Class AbstractSpectrumAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • xtrememp.visualization.AbstractVisualization
      • xtrememp.visualization.AbstractSpectrumAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractVisualization>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FullColorSpectrogram, FullSpectrogram, FullSpectrum, PianoRoll, QuarterColorSpectrogram, QuarterSpectrogram, QuarterSpectrum, SpectrumBars, WhiteFullSpectrum, WhiteQuarterSpectrum

    public abstract class AbstractSpectrumAnalyzer
extends AbstractVisualization
    An abstract class that serves as a base class for all spectrum analyzers.

      • calculateMagnitudes

      • applySelectedScale

        public float[] applySelectedScale(int scale,
                                  float[] binArray)
        This method merges the real and imaginary parts of the binArray[] produced by the FFT, and allows us to change the scale of the resulting spectral values between (1) amplitude, (2) power, and (3) dB. Ultimately, this will be user-selectable through the GUI.
        Parameters:
        scale - selects whether to use amplitude, power, or dB.
        binArray - array of input spectral bin values from the FFT.
        Returns:
        An array of the resulting spectral values with the selected scale applied to.

      • computeFFT

        public float[] computeFFT(float[] binArray)

      • applyMaxOverLineNormalization

        public float[] applyMaxOverLineNormalization(float[] binArray)
        This method normalizes the spectral values in the input array to a range from 0.0 to 1.0 using the max-over-line scheme. This normalizes the input array such that the maximum value in each line of spectral values is 1.0. A negative side-effect is that during quiet music passages, the noise background is amplified and shows up distinctly in the visualization.
        Parameters:
        binArray - - the array of input values
        Returns:
        - an array of output values
